013package org.apache.juneau;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConsumerUtils.*;
019import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
021
022import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
023import java.lang.reflect.*;
024import java.util.*;
025import java.util.concurrent.*;
026import java.util.function.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.csv.annotation.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.html.annotation.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
033import org.apache.juneau.json.annotation.*;
034import org.apache.juneau.jsonschema.annotation.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.msgpack.annotation.*;
036import org.apache.juneau.oapi.annotation.*;
037import org.apache.juneau.parser.annotation.*;
038import org.apache.juneau.plaintext.annotation.*;
039import org.apache.juneau.reflect.*;
040import org.apache.juneau.serializer.annotation.*;
041import org.apache.juneau.soap.annotation.*;
042import org.apache.juneau.svl.*;
043import org.apache.juneau.uon.annotation.*;
044import org.apache.juneau.urlencoding.annotation.*;
045import org.apache.juneau.utils.*;
046import org.apache.juneau.xml.annotation.*;
047
048/**
049 * Base class for all Context beans.
050 *
051 * <p>
052 * Context beans follow the convention of havinTg the following parts:
053 * <ul>
054 *    <li>A {@link Builder} class for configuring the context bean.
055 *    <ul>
056 *       <li>This bean is non-thread-safe and meant for one-time use.
057 *    </ul>
058 *    <li>A {@link Context#Context(Builder)} constructor that takes in a builder object.
059 *    <ul>
060 *       <li>This bean is thread-safe and cacheable/reusable.
061 *    </ul>
062 *    <li>A {@link ContextSession} class for doing work.
063 *    <ul>
064 *       <li>This bean is non-thread-safe and meant for one-time use.
065 *    </ul>
066 *
067 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
068 *    <li class='note'>This class is thread safe and reusable.
069 * </ul>
070 *
071 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
072 * </ul>
073 */
074public abstract class Context implements AnnotationProvider {
075
076   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
077   // Static
078   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
079
080   private static final Map<Class<?>,MethodInfo> BUILDER_CREATE_METHODS = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
081
082   /**
083    * Predicate for annotations that themselves are annotated with {@link ContextApply}.
084    */
085   public static final Predicate<AnnotationInfo<?>> CONTEXT_APPLY_FILTER = x -> x.hasAnnotation(ContextApply.class);
086
087   /**
088    * Instantiates a builder of the specified context class.
089    *
090    * <p>
091    * Looks for a public static method called <c>create</c> that returns an object that can be passed into a public
092    * or protected constructor of the class.
093    *
094    * @param type The builder to create.
095    * @return A new builder.
096    */
097   public static Builder createBuilder(Class<? extends Context> type) {
098      try {
099         MethodInfo mi = BUILDER_CREATE_METHODS.get(type);
100         if (mi == null) {
101            ClassInfo c = ClassInfo.of(type);
102            for (ConstructorInfo ci : c.getPublicConstructors()) {
103               if (ci.matches(x -> x.hasNumParams(1) && ! x.getParam(0).getParameterType().is(type))) {
104                  mi = c.getPublicMethod(
105                     x -> x.isStatic()
106                     && x.isNotDeprecated()
107                     && x.hasName("create")
108                     && x.hasReturnType(ci.getParam(0).getParameterType())
109                  );
110                  if (mi != null)
111                     break;
112               }
113            }
114            if (mi == null)
115               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Could not find builder create method on class {0}", type);
116            BUILDER_CREATE_METHODS.put(type, mi);
117         }
118         Builder b = (Builder)mi.invoke(null);
119         b.type(type);
120         return b;
121      } catch (ExecutableException e) {
122         throw asRuntimeException(e);
123      }
124   }
125
126   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
127   // Builder
128   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
129
130   /**
131    * Builder class.
132    */
133   @FluentSetters
134   public abstract static class Builder {
135
136      private static final Map<Class<?>,ConstructorInfo> CONTEXT_CONSTRUCTORS = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
137
138      boolean debug;
139      Class<? extends Context> type;
140      Context impl;
141      List<Annotation> annotations;
142      Cache<HashKey,? extends Context> cache;
143
144      private final List<Object> builders = Utils.list();
145      private final AnnotationWorkList applied = AnnotationWorkList.create();
146
147      /**
148       * Constructor.
149       * Default settings.
150       */
151      @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
152      protected Builder() {
153         debug = env("Context.debug", false);
154         annotations = null;
155         registerBuilders(this);
156
157         // By default, the type being created should be the class declaring the builder.
158         Class<?> dc = getClass().getDeclaringClass();
159         if (Context.class.isAssignableFrom(dc))
160            type((Class<? extends Context>)dc);
161      }
162
163      /**
164       * Copy constructor.
165       *
166       * @param copyFrom The bean to copy from.
167       */
168      protected Builder(Context copyFrom) {
169         debug = copyFrom.debug;
170         type = copyFrom.getClass();
171         annotations = listFrom(copyFrom.annotations, true);
172         registerBuilders(this);
173      }
174
175      /**
176       * Copy constructor.
177       *
178       * @param copyFrom The builder to copy from.
179       */
180      protected Builder(Builder copyFrom) {
181         debug = copyFrom.debug;
182         type = copyFrom.type;
183         annotations = listFrom(copyFrom.annotations, true);
184         registerBuilders(this);
185      }
186
187      private Context innerBuild() {
188         if (type == null)
189            throw new BasicRuntimeException("Type not specified for context builder {0}", getClass().getName());
190         if (impl != null && type.isInstance(impl))
191            return type.cast(impl);
192         if (cache != null)
193            return cache.get(hashKey(), ()->getContextConstructor().invoke(this));
194         return getContextConstructor().invoke(this);
195      }
196
197      private ConstructorInfo getContextConstructor() {
198         ConstructorInfo cci = CONTEXT_CONSTRUCTORS.get(type);
199         if (cci == null) {
200            cci = ClassInfo.of(type).getPublicConstructor(
201               x -> x.hasNumParams(1)
202               && x.getParam(0).canAccept(this)
203            );
204            if (cci == null)
205               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Public constructor not found: {0}({1})", className(type), className(this));
206            CONTEXT_CONSTRUCTORS.put(type, cci);
207         }
208         return cci;
209      }
210
211      /**
212       * Copy creator.
213       *
214       * @return A new mutable copy of this builder.
215       */
216      public abstract Builder copy();
217
218      /**
219       * Build the object.
220       *
221       * @return The built object.
222       */
223      public Context build() {
224         return innerBuild();
225      }
226
227      /**
228       * Returns the hashkey of this builder.
229       *
230       * <p>
231       * Used to return previously instantiated context beans that have matching hashkeys.
232       * The {@link HashKey} object is suitable for use as a hashmap key of a map of context beans.
233       * A context bean is considered equivalent if the {@link HashKey#equals(Object)} method is the same.
234       *
235       * @return The hashkey of this builder.
236       */
237      public HashKey hashKey() {
238         return HashKey.of(debug, type, annotations);
239      }
240
241      /**
242       * Specifies a cache to use for hashkey-based caching.
243       *
244       * @param value The cache.
245       * @return This object.
246       */
247      @FluentSetter
248      public Builder cache(Cache<HashKey,? extends Context> value) {
249         this.cache = value;
250         return this;
251      }
252
253      /**
254       * Convenience method for calling {@link #build()} while avoiding a cast.
255       *
256       * @param <T> The type to cast the built object to.
257       * @param c The type to cast the built object to.
258       * @return The built context bean.
259       */
260      @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
261      public final <T extends Context> T build(Class<T> c) {
262         if (type == null || ! c.isAssignableFrom(type))
263            type = c;
264         return (T)innerBuild();
265      }
266
267      /**
268       * Apply a consumer to this builder.
269       *
270       * @param <T> The builder subtype that this consumer can be applied to.
271       * @param subtype The builder subtype that this consumer can be applied to.
272       * @param consumer The consumer.
273       * @return This object.
274       */
275      public <T extends Builder> Builder apply(Class<T> subtype, Consumer<T> consumer) {
276         if (subtype.isInstance(this))
277            consumer.accept(subtype.cast(this));
278         return this;
279      }
280
281      /**
282       * Associates a context class with this builder.
283       *
284       * <p>
285       * This is the type of object that this builder creates when the {@link #build()} method is called.
286       *
287       * <p>
288       * By default, it's the outer class of where the builder class is defined.
289       *
290       * @param value The context class that this builder should create.
291       * @return This object.
292       */
293      @FluentSetter
294      public Builder type(Class<? extends Context> value) {
295         this.type = value;
296         return this;
297      }
298
299      /**
300       * Returns the context class that this builder should create.
301       *
302       * @return The context class if it was specified.
303       */
304      public Optional<Class<?>> getType() {
305         return Utils.opt(type);
306      }
307
308      /**
309       * Specifies a pre-instantiated bean for the {@link #build()} method to return.
310       *
311       * @param value The value for this setting.
312       * @return This object.
313       */
314      @FluentSetter
315      public Builder impl(Context value) {
316         impl = value;
317         return this;
318      }
319
320      /**
321       * Returns <jk>true</jk> if any of the annotations/appliers can be applied to this builder.
322       *
323       * @param work The work to check.
324       * @return <jk>true</jk> if any of the annotations/appliers can be applied to this builder.
325       */
326      public boolean canApply(AnnotationWorkList work) {
327         Flag f = Flag.create();
328         work.forEach(x -> builders.forEach(b -> f.setIf(x.canApply(b))));
329         return f.isSet();
330      }
331
332      /**
333       * Applies a set of applied to this builder.
334       *
335       * <p>
336       * An {@link AnnotationWork} consists of a single pair of {@link AnnotationInfo} that represents an annotation instance,
337       * and {@link AnnotationApplier} which represents the code used to apply the values in that annotation to a specific builder.
338       *
339       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
340       * <p class='bjava'>
341       *    <jc>// A class annotated with a config annotation.</jc>
342       *    <ja>@BeanConfig</ja>(sortProperties=<js>"$S{sortProperties,false}"</js>)
343       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyClass {...}
344       *
345       *    <jc>// Find all annotations that themselves are annotated with @ContextPropertiesApply.</jc>
346       *    AnnotationList <jv>annotations</jv> = ClassInfo.<jsm>of</jsm>(MyClass.<jk>class</jk>).getAnnotationList(<jsf>CONTEXT_APPLY_FILTER</jsf>);
347       *    VarResolverSession <jv>vrs</jv> = VarResolver.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.createSession();
348       *    AnnotationWorkList <jv>work</jv> = AnnotationWorkList.of(<jv>vrs</jv>, <jv>annotations</jv>);
349       *
350       *    <jc>// Apply any settings found on the annotations.</jc>
351       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
352       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
353       *       .apply(<jv>work</jv>)
354       *       .build();
355       * </p>
356       *
357       * @param work The list of annotations and appliers to apply to this builder.
358       * @return This object.
359       */
360      @FluentSetter
361      public Builder apply(AnnotationWorkList work) {
362         applied.addAll(work);
363         work.forEach(x -> builders.forEach(x::apply));
364         return this;
365      }
366
367      /**
368       * Returns all the annotations that have been applied to this builder.
369       *
370       * @return All the annotations that have been applied to this builder.
371       */
372      public AnnotationWorkList getApplied() {
373         return applied;
374      }
375
376      /**
377       * Registers the specified secondary builders with this context builder.
378       *
379       * <p>
380       * When {@link #apply(AnnotationWorkList)} is called, it gets called on all registered builders.
381       *
382       * @param builders The builders to add to the list of builders.
383       */
384      protected void registerBuilders(Object...builders) {
385         for (Object b : builders) {
386            if (b == this)
387               this.builders.add(b);
388            else if (b instanceof Builder b2)
389               this.builders.addAll(b2.builders);
390            else
391               this.builders.add(b);
392         }
393      }
394
395      /**
396       * Applies any of the various <ja>@XConfig</ja> annotations on the specified classes or methods to this context.
397       *
398       * <p>
399       * Any annotations found that themselves are annotated with {@link ContextApply} will be resolved and
400       * applied as properties to this builder.  These annotations include:
401       * <ul class='javatreec'>
402       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link BeanConfig}
403       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link CsvConfig}
404       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link HtmlConfig}
405       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link HtmlDocConfig}
406       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link JsonConfig}
407       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link JsonSchemaConfig}
408       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link MsgPackConfig}
409       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link OpenApiConfig}
410       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link ParserConfig}
411       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link PlainTextConfig}
412       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link SerializerConfig}
413       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link SoapXmlConfig}
414       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link UonConfig}
415       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link UrlEncodingConfig}
416       *    <li class ='ja'>{@link XmlConfig}
417       *    <li class ='ja'><c>RdfConfig</c>
418       * </ul>
419       *
420       * <p>
421       * Annotations on classes are appended in the following order:
422       * <ol>
423       *    <li>On the package of this class.
424       *    <li>On interfaces ordered parent-to-child.
425       *    <li>On parent classes ordered parent-to-child.
426       *    <li>On this class.
427       * </ol>
428       *
429       * <p>
430       * Annotations on methods are appended in the following order:
431       * <ol>
432       *    <li>On the package of the method class.
433       *    <li>On interfaces ordered parent-to-child.
434       *    <li>On parent classes ordered parent-to-child.
435       *    <li>On the method class.
436       *    <li>On this method and matching methods ordered parent-to-child.
437       * </ol>
438       *
439       * <p>
440       * The default var resolver {@link VarResolver#DEFAULT} is used to resolve any variables in annotation field values.
441       *
442       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
443       * <p class='bjava'>
444       *    <jc>// A class annotated with a config annotation.</jc>
445       *    <ja>@BeanConfig</ja>(sortProperties=<js>"$S{sortProperties,false}"</js>)
446       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyClass {...}
447       *
448       *    <jc>// Apply any settings found on the annotations.</jc>
449       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
450       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
451       *       .applyAnnotations(MyClass.<jk>class</jk>)
452       *       .build();
453       *
454       *    <jc>// A method annotated with a config annotation.</jc>
455       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyClass {
456       *       <ja>@BeanConfig</ja>(sortProperties=<js>"$S{sortProperties,false}"</js>)
457       *       <jk>public void</jk> myMethod() {...}
458       *    }
459       *
460       *    <jc>// Apply any settings found on the annotations.</jc>
461       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
462       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
463       *       .applyAnnotations(MyClass.<jk>class</jk>.getMethod(<js>"myMethod"</js>))
464       *       .build();
465       * </p>
466       *
467       * @param from The classes or methods on which the annotations are defined.
468       *    Can be any of the following types:
469       *    <ul>
470       *       <li>{@link Class}
471       *       <li>{@link ClassInfo}
472       *       <li>{@link Method}
473       *       <li>{@link MethodInfo}
474       *    <li>A collection/stream/array of anything on this list.
475       * @return This object.
476       */
477      @FluentSetter
478      public Builder applyAnnotations(Object...from) {
479         var work = AnnotationWorkList.create();
480         Arrays.stream(from).forEach(x -> traverse(work, x));
481         return apply(work);
482      }
483
484      private AnnotationWorkList traverse(AnnotationWorkList work, Object x) {
485         Utils.traverse(x, y -> {
486            if (x instanceof Class<?> x2)
487               work.add(ClassInfo.of(x2).getAnnotationList(CONTEXT_APPLY_FILTER));
488            else if (x instanceof ClassInfo x2)
489               work.add(x2.getAnnotationList(CONTEXT_APPLY_FILTER));
490            else if (x instanceof Method x2)
491               work.add(MethodInfo.of(x2).getAnnotationList(CONTEXT_APPLY_FILTER));
492            else if (x instanceof MethodInfo x2)
493               work.add(x2.getAnnotationList(CONTEXT_APPLY_FILTER));
494            else
495               throw illegalArg("Invalid type passed to applyAnnotations:  {0}", x.getClass().getName());
496         });
497         return work;
498      }
499
500      /**
501       * Same as {@link #applyAnnotations(Object...)} but explicitly specifies a class varargs to avoid compilation warnings.
502       *
503       * @param from The classes or methods on which the annotations are defined.
504       * @return This object.
505       */
506      @FluentSetter
507      public Builder applyAnnotations(Class<?>...from) {
508         return applyAnnotations((Object[])from);
509      }
510
511      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
512      // Properties
513      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
514
515      /**
516       * Defines annotations to apply to specific classes and methods.
517       *
518       * <p>
519       * Allows you to dynamically apply Juneau annotations typically applied directly to classes and methods.
520       * Useful in cases where you want to use the functionality of the annotation on beans and bean properties but
521       * do not have access to the code to do so.
522       *
523       * <p>
524       * As a rule, any Juneau annotation with an <l>on()</l> method can be used with this setting.
525       *
526       * <p>
527       * The following example shows the equivalent methods for applying the {@link Bean @Bean} annotation:
528       * <p class='bjava'>
529       *    <jc>// Class with explicit annotation.</jc>
530       *    <ja>@Bean</ja>(properties=<js>"street,city,state"</js>)
531       *    <jk>public class</jk> A {...}
532       *
533       *    <jc>// Class with annotation applied via @BeanConfig</jc>
534       *    <jk>public class</jk> B {...}
535       *
536       *    <jc>// Java REST method with @BeanConfig annotation.</jc>
537       *    <ja>@RestGet</ja>(...)
538       *    <ja>@Bean</ja>(on=<js>"B"</js>, properties=<js>"street,city,state"</js>)
539       *    <jk>public void</jk> doFoo() {...}
540       * </p>
541       *
542       * <p>
543       * In general, the underlying framework uses this method when it finds dynamically applied annotations on
544       * config annotations.  However, concrete implementations of annotations are also provided that can be passed
545       * directly into builder classes like so:
546       * <p class='bjava'>
547       *    <jc>// Create a concrete @Bean annotation.</jc>
548       *    <ja>Bean</ja> <jv>annotation</jv> = BeanAnnotation.<jsm>create</jsm>(B.<jk>class</jk>).properties(<js>"street,city,state"</js>).build();
549       *
550       *    <jc>// Apply it to a serializer.</jc>
551       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer.<jsm>create</jsm>().annotations(<jv>annotation</jv>).build();
552       *
553       *    <jc>// Serialize a bean with the dynamically applied annotation.</jc>
554       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> B());
555       * </p>
556       *
557       * <p>
558       * The following is the list of annotations builders provided that can be constructed
559       * and passed into the builder class:
560       * <ul class='javatreec'>
561       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.annotation.BeanAnnotation}
562       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.annotation.BeancAnnotation}
563       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.annotation.BeanIgnoreAnnotation}
564       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.annotation.BeanpAnnotation}
565       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.annotation.ExampleAnnotation}
566       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.annotation.NamePropertyAnnotation}
567       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.annotation.ParentPropertyAnnotation}
568       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.annotation.SwapAnnotation}
569       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.annotation.UriAnnotation}
570       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.csv.annotation.CsvAnnotation}
571       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.html.annotation.HtmlAnnotation}
572       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.json.annotation.JsonAnnotation}
573       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.annotation.SchemaAnnotation}
574       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.msgpack.annotation.MsgPackAnnotation}
575       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.oapi.annotation.OpenApiAnnotation}
576       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.plaintext.annotation.PlainTextAnnotation}
577       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.soap.annotation.SoapXmlAnnotation}
578       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.uon.annotation.UonAnnotation}
579       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.urlencoding.annotation.UrlEncodingAnnotation}
580       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.xml.annotation.XmlAnnotation}
581       * </ul>
582       *
583       * <p>
584       * The syntax for the <l>on()</l> pattern match parameter depends on whether it applies to a class, method, field, or constructor.
585       * The valid pattern matches are:
586       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
587       *  <li>Classes:
588       *       <ul>
589       *          <li>Fully qualified:
590       *             <ul>
591       *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass"</js>
592       *             </ul>
593       *          <li>Fully qualified inner class:
594       *             <ul>
595       *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass$Inner1$Inner2"</js>
596       *             </ul>
597       *          <li>Simple:
598       *             <ul>
599       *                <li><js>"MyClass"</js>
600       *             </ul>
601       *          <li>Simple inner:
602       *             <ul>
603       *                <li><js>"MyClass$Inner1$Inner2"</js>
604       *                <li><js>"Inner1$Inner2"</js>
605       *                <li><js>"Inner2"</js>
606       *             </ul>
607       *       </ul>
608       *    <li>Methods:
609       *       <ul>
610       *          <li>Fully qualified with args:
611       *             <ul>
612       *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod(String,int)"</js>
613       *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod(java.lang.String,int)"</js>
614       *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod()"</js>
615       *             </ul>
616       *          <li>Fully qualified:
617       *             <ul>
618       *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod"</js>
619       *             </ul>
620       *          <li>Simple with args:
621       *             <ul>
622       *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod(String,int)"</js>
623       *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod(java.lang.String,int)"</js>
624       *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod()"</js>
625       *             </ul>
626       *          <li>Simple:
627       *             <ul>
628       *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod"</js>
629       *             </ul>
630       *          <li>Simple inner class:
631       *             <ul>
632       *                <li><js>"MyClass$Inner1$Inner2.myMethod"</js>
633       *                <li><js>"Inner1$Inner2.myMethod"</js>
634       *                <li><js>"Inner2.myMethod"</js>
635       *             </ul>
636       *       </ul>
637       *    <li>Fields:
638       *       <ul>
639       *          <li>Fully qualified:
640       *             <ul>
641       *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myField"</js>
642       *             </ul>
643       *          <li>Simple:
644       *             <ul>
645       *                <li><js>"MyClass.myField"</js>
646       *             </ul>
647       *          <li>Simple inner class:
648       *             <ul>
649       *                <li><js>"MyClass$Inner1$Inner2.myField"</js>
650       *                <li><js>"Inner1$Inner2.myField"</js>
651       *                <li><js>"Inner2.myField"</js>
652       *             </ul>
653       *       </ul>
654       *    <li>Constructors:
655       *       <ul>
656       *          <li>Fully qualified with args:
657       *             <ul>
658       *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass(String,int)"</js>
659       *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass(java.lang.String,int)"</js>
660       *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass()"</js>
661       *             </ul>
662       *          <li>Simple with args:
663       *             <ul>
664       *                <li><js>"MyClass(String,int)"</js>
665       *                <li><js>"MyClass(java.lang.String,int)"</js>
666       *                <li><js>"MyClass()"</js>
667       *             </ul>
668       *          <li>Simple inner class:
669       *             <ul>
670       *                <li><js>"MyClass$Inner1$Inner2()"</js>
671       *                <li><js>"Inner1$Inner2()"</js>
672       *                <li><js>"Inner2()"</js>
673       *             </ul>
674       *       </ul>
675       *    <li>A comma-delimited list of anything on this list.
676       * </ul>
677       *
678       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
679       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig}
680       * </ul>
681       *
682       * @param values
683       *    The annotations to register with the context.
684       * @return This object.
685       */
686      @FluentSetter
687      public Builder annotations(Annotation...values) {
688         annotations = addAll(annotations, values);
689         return this;
690      }
691
692      /**
693       * Same as {@link #annotations(Annotation...)} but uses a list as input.
694       *
695       * @param values
696       *    The annotations to register with the context.
697       * @return This object.
698       */
699      @FluentSetter
700      public Builder annotations(List<Annotation> values) {
701         annotations = addAll(annotations, values);
702         return this;
703      }
704
705      /**
706       * <i><l>Context</l> configuration property:&emsp;</i>  Debug mode.
707       *
708       * <p>
709       * Enables the following additional information during serialization:
710       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
711       *    <li>
712       *       When bean getters throws exceptions, the exception includes the object stack information
713       *       in order to determine how that method was invoked.
714       *    <li>
715       *       Enables {@link BeanTraverseContext.Builder#detectRecursions()}.
716       * </ul>
717       *
718       * <p>
719       * Enables the following additional information during parsing:
720       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
721       *    <li>
722       *       When bean setters throws exceptions, the exception includes the object stack information
723       *       in order to determine how that method was invoked.
724       * </ul>
725       *
726       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
727       * <p class='bjava'>
728       *    <jc>// Create a serializer with debug enabled.</jc>
729       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
730       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
731       *       .debug()
732       *       .build();
733       *
734       *    <jc>// Create a POJO model with a recursive loop.</jc>
735       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
736       *       <jk>public</jk> Object <jf>f</jf>;
737       *    }
738       *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jk>new</jk> MyBean();
739       *    <jv>bean</jv>.<jf>f</jf> = <jv>bean</jv>;
740       *
741       *    <jc>// Throws a SerializeException and not a StackOverflowError</jc>
742       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jv>bean</jv>);
743       * </p>
744       *
745       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
746       *    <li class='ja'>{@link org.apache.juneau.annotation.BeanConfig#debug()}
747       *    <li class='jm'>{@link org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder#debug(Boolean)}
748       * </ul>
749       *
750       * @return This object.
751       */
752      @FluentSetter
753      public Builder debug() {
754         return debug(true);
755      }
756
757      /**
758       * Same as {@link #debug()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
759       *
760       * @param value The value for this setting.
761       * @return This object.
762       */
763      @FluentSetter
764      public Builder debug(boolean value) {
765         debug = value;
766         return this;
767      }
768
769      /**
770       * Returns <jk>true</jk> if debug is enabled.
771       *
772       * @return <jk>true</jk> if debug is enabled.
773       */
774      public boolean isDebug() {
775         return debug;
776      }
777
778      // <FluentSetters>
779
780      // </FluentSetters>
781   }
782
783   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
784   // Instance
785   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
786
787   final List<Annotation> annotations;
788   final boolean debug;
789
790   private final ReflectionMap<Annotation> annotationMap;
791   private final TwoKeyConcurrentCache<Class<?>,Class<? extends Annotation>,Annotation[]> classAnnotationCache;
792   private final TwoKeyConcurrentCache<Class<?>,Class<? extends Annotation>,Annotation[]> declaredClassAnnotationCache;
793   private final TwoKeyConcurrentCache<Method,Class<? extends Annotation>,Annotation[]> methodAnnotationCache;
794   private final TwoKeyConcurrentCache<Field,Class<? extends Annotation>,Annotation[]> fieldAnnotationCache;
795   private final TwoKeyConcurrentCache<Constructor<?>,Class<? extends Annotation>,Annotation[]> constructorAnnotationCache;
796
797   /**
798    * Copy constructor.
799    *
800    * @param copyFrom The context to copy from.
801    */
802   protected Context(Context copyFrom) {
803      annotationMap = copyFrom.annotationMap;
804      annotations = copyFrom.annotations;
805      debug = copyFrom.debug;
806      classAnnotationCache = copyFrom.classAnnotationCache;
807      declaredClassAnnotationCache = copyFrom.declaredClassAnnotationCache;
808      methodAnnotationCache = copyFrom.methodAnnotationCache;
809      fieldAnnotationCache = copyFrom.fieldAnnotationCache;
810      constructorAnnotationCache = copyFrom.constructorAnnotationCache;
811   }
812
813   /**
814    * Constructor for this class.
815    *
816    * @param builder The builder for this class.
817    */
818   protected Context(Builder builder) {
819      init(builder);
820      debug = builder.debug;
821      annotations = Utils.opt(builder.annotations).orElseGet(Collections::emptyList);
822
823      ReflectionMap.Builder<Annotation> rmb = ReflectionMap.create(Annotation.class);
824
825      annotations.forEach(a -> {
826         try {
827            ClassInfo ci = ClassInfo.of(a.getClass());
828
829            MethodInfo mi = ci.getPublicMethod(x -> x.hasName("onClass"));
830            if (mi != null) {
831               if (! mi.getReturnType().is(Class[].class))
832                  throw new ConfigException("Invalid annotation @{0} used in BEAN_annotations property.  Annotation must define an onClass() method that returns a Class array.", a.getClass().getSimpleName());
833               for (Class<?> c : (Class<?>[])mi.accessible().invoke(a))
834                  rmb.append(c.getName(), a);
835            }
836
837            mi = ci.getPublicMethod(x -> x.hasName("on"));
838            if (mi != null) {
839               if (! mi.getReturnType().is(String[].class))
840                  throw new ConfigException("Invalid annotation @{0} used in BEAN_annotations property.  Annotation must define an on() method that returns a String array.", a.getClass().getSimpleName());
841               for (String s : (String[])mi.accessible().invoke(a))
842                  rmb.append(s, a);
843            }
844
845         } catch (Exception e) {
846            throw new ConfigException(e, "Invalid annotation @{0} used in BEAN_annotations property.", className(a));
847         }
848      });
849      this.annotationMap = rmb.build();
850      boolean disabled = Boolean.getBoolean("juneau.disableAnnotationCaching");
851      classAnnotationCache = new TwoKeyConcurrentCache<>(disabled, (k1,k2) -> annotationMap.appendAll(k1, k2, k1.getAnnotationsByType(k2)));
852      declaredClassAnnotationCache = new TwoKeyConcurrentCache<>(disabled, (k1,k2) -> annotationMap.appendAll(k1, k2, k1.getDeclaredAnnotationsByType(k2)));
853      methodAnnotationCache = new TwoKeyConcurrentCache<>(disabled, (k1,k2) -> annotationMap.appendAll(k1, k2, k1.getAnnotationsByType(k2)));
854      fieldAnnotationCache = new TwoKeyConcurrentCache<>(disabled, (k1,k2) -> annotationMap.appendAll(k1, k2, k1.getAnnotationsByType(k2)));
855      constructorAnnotationCache = new TwoKeyConcurrentCache<>(disabled, (k1,k2) -> annotationMap.appendAll(k1, k2, k1.getAnnotationsByType(k2)));
856   }
857
858   /**
859    * Perform optional initialization on builder before it is used.
860    *
861    * <p>
862    * Default behavior is a no-op.
863    *
864    * @param builder The builder to initialize.
865    */
866   protected void init(Builder builder) {}
867
868   /**
869    * Creates a builder from this context object.
870    *
871    * <p>
872    * Builders are used to define new contexts (e.g. serializers, parsers) based on existing configurations.
873    *
874    * @return A new Builder object.
875    */
876   public Builder copy() {
877      throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not implemented.");
878   }
879
880   /**
881    * Create a session builder based on the properties defined on this context.
882    *
883    * <p>
884    * Use this method for creating sessions where you want to override basic settings.
885    * Otherwise, use {@link #getSession()} directly.
886    *
887    * @return A new session builder.
888    */
889   public ContextSession.Builder createSession() {
890      throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not implemented.");
891   }
892
893   /**
894    * Returns a session to use for this context.
895    *
896    * <p>
897    * Note that subclasses may opt to return a reusable non-modifiable session.
898    *
899    * @return A new session object.
900    */
901   public ContextSession getSession() {
902      return createSession().build();
903   }

911    *
912    * @see Context.Builder#debug()
913    * @return
914    *    <jk>true</jk> if debug mode is enabled.
915    */
916   public boolean isDebug() {
917      return debug;
918   }

924   @Override /* MetaProvider */
925   public <A extends Annotation> void forEachAnnotation(Class<A> type, Class<?> onClass, Predicate<A> filter, Consumer<A> action) {
926      if (type != null && onClass != null)
927         for (A a : annotations(type, onClass))
928            consume(filter, action, a);
929   }
930
931   @Override /* MetaProvider */
932   public <A extends Annotation> A firstAnnotation(Class<A> type, Class<?> onClass, Predicate<A> filter) {
933      if (type != null && onClass != null)
934         for (A a : annotations(type, onClass))
935            if (test(filter, a))
936               return a;
937      return null;
938   }
939
940   @Override /* MetaProvider */
941   public <A extends Annotation> A lastAnnotation(Class<A> type, Class<?> onClass, Predicate<A> filter) {
942      A x = null;
943      if (type != null && onClass != null)
944         for (A a : annotations(type, onClass))
945            if (test(filter, a))
946               x = a;
947      return x;
948   }
949
950   @Override /* MetaProvider */
951   public <A extends Annotation> void forEachDeclaredAnnotation(Class<A> type, Class<?> onClass, Predicate<A> filter, Consumer<A> action) {
952      if (type != null && onClass != null)
953         for (A a : declaredAnnotations(type, onClass))
954            consume(filter, action, a);
955   }
956
957   @Override /* MetaProvider */
958   public <A extends Annotation> A firstDeclaredAnnotation(Class<A> type, Class<?> onClass, Predicate<A> filter) {
959      if (type != null && onClass != null)
960         for (A a : declaredAnnotations(type, onClass))
961            if (test(filter, a))
962               return a;
963      return null;
964   }
965
966   @Override /* MetaProvider */
967   public <A extends Annotation> A lastDeclaredAnnotation(Class<A> type, Class<?> onClass, Predicate<A> filter) {
968      A x = null;
969      if (type != null && onClass != null)
970         for (A a : declaredAnnotations(type, onClass))
971            if (test(filter, a))
972               x = a;
973      return x;
974   }

978      if (type != null && onMethod != null)

980            consume(filter, action, a);

996         for (A a : annotations(type, onMethod))

1053
1054   /**
1055    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if <c>getAnnotation(a,c)</c> returns a non-null value.
1056    *
1057    * @param <A> The annotation being checked for.
1058    * @param type The annotation being checked for.
1059    * @param onClass The class being checked on.
1060    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the annotation exists on the specified class.
1061    */
1062   public <A extends Annotation> boolean hasAnnotation(Class<A> type, Class<?> onClass) {
1063      return annotations(type, onClass).length > 0;
1064   }
1065
1066   /**
1067    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if <c>getAnnotation(a,m)</c> returns a non-null value.
1068    *
1069    * @param <A> The annotation being checked for.
1070    * @param type The annotation being checked for.
1071    * @param onMethod The method being checked on.
1072    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the annotation exists on the specified method.
1073    */
1074   public <A extends Annotation> boolean hasAnnotation(Class<A> type, Method onMethod) {
1075      return annotations(type, onMethod).length > 0;
1076   }
1077
1078   /**
1079    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if <c>getAnnotation(a,f)</c> returns a non-null value.
1080    *
1081    * @param <A> The annotation being checked for.
1082    * @param type The annotation being checked for.
1083    * @param onField The field being checked on.
1084    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the annotation exists on the specified field.
1085    */
1086   public <A extends Annotation> boolean hasAnnotation(Class<A> type, Field onField) {
1087      return annotations(type, onField).length > 0;
1088   }
1089
1090   /**
1091    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if <c>getAnnotation(a,c)</c> returns a non-null value.
1092    *
1093    * @param <A> The annotation being checked for.
1094    * @param type The annotation being checked for.
1095    * @param onConstructor The constructor being checked on.
1096    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the annotation exists on the specified field.
1097    */
1098   public <A extends Annotation> boolean hasAnnotation(Class<A> type, Constructor<?> onConstructor) {
1099      return annotations(type, onConstructor).length > 0;
1100   }
1101
1102   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1103   private <A extends Annotation> A[] annotations(Class<A> type, Class<?> onClass) {
1104      return (A[])classAnnotationCache.get(onClass, type);
1105   }
1106
1107   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1108   private <A extends Annotation> A[] declaredAnnotations(Class<A> type, Class<?> onClass) {
1109      return (A[])declaredClassAnnotationCache.get(onClass, type);
1110   }
1111
1112   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1113   private <A extends Annotation> A[] annotations(Class<A> type, Method onMethod) {
1114      return (A[])methodAnnotationCache.get(onMethod, type);
1115   }
1116
1117   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1118   private <A extends Annotation> A[] annotations(Class<A> type, Field onField) {
1119      return (A[])fieldAnnotationCache.get(onField, type);
1120   }
1121
1122   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1123   private <A extends Annotation> A[] annotations(Class<A> type, Constructor<?> onConstructor) {
1124      return (A[])constructorAnnotationCache.get(onConstructor, type);
1125   }

1131   /**
1132    * Returns the properties on this bean as a map for debugging.
1133    *
1134    * @return The properties on this bean as a map for debugging.
1135    */
1136   protected JsonMap properties() {
1137      return filteredMap("annotations", annotations, "debug", debug);
1138   }
1139
1140   @Override /* Object */
1141   public String toString() {
1142      return Utils2.toPropertyMap(this).asReadableString();
1143   }
